summary: This is a sealed transcript of a conference before Chief District Judge Colleen McMahon regarding a grand jury subpoena (19 Misc. 149). The Assistant U.S. Attorney provides details about the opening of an investigation in late November/early December 2018 and contacts with the law firm Boies Schiller regarding victims and witnesses. The judge grants the government's request related to the subpoena.

persons.name: Colleen McMahon
persons.context: Presiding judge over the conference regarding the grand jury subpoena. She questions the government about contacts with the Boies Schiller firm prior to the subpoena's issuance.

persons.name: MR. [Redacted]
persons.context: Appears for the government, provides details about the investigation's opening and contacts with victim/witness counsel, including Boies Schiller.

connections.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney appearing before and providing information to the presiding Chief District Judge regarding a grand jury subpoena application.

events.title: Investigation Opened (Possible Date)
events.description: The government states the investigation was opened on either Friday, November 30, or Monday, December 3, 2018.

events.title: Investigation Opened (Possible Date)
events.description: The government states the investigation was opened on either Friday, November 30, or Monday, December 3, 2018.

events.title: Court Conference on Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: Conference before Judge McMahon where the government details the investigation timeline and contacts with counsel, resulting in the granting of the government's request.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a sealed transcript of a court conference regarding Grand Jury Subpoena 19 Misc. 149.
A federal investigation related to the Epstein case was opened in late November or early December 2018 (Nov 30 or Dec 3).
The government contacted the law firm Boies Schiller, among other plaintiff/witness counsel, early in the investigation regarding their representation of victims or witnesses.
Boies Schiller indicated a protective order might govern some materials, leading to the government's application to the court.
Judge Colleen McMahon granted the government's request related to the subpoena after questioning them about pre-subpoena contacts.
